https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-04-09/opec-agrees-on-deep-oil-output-cuts-to-fight-market-slump?srnd=premium-asia

Saudi-Russia Oil Deal Under Threat as Mexico Walks Out of OPEC+ Talks

An agreement between Saudi Arabia and Russia for record oil-production cuts was endangered late on Thursday as Mexico refused to participate in the curbs and left the meeting without approving the deal.

The impasse, which came after more than 9 hours of talks via video link, cast doubt over a global effort to revive the oil market from a debilitating coronavirus-induced slump. The OPEC+ group won’t cut output without Mexico’s participation and doesn’t intend to meet again on Friday, instead focusing on talks at the G-20 gathering also scheduled that day, according to a delegate.

Earlier on Thursday, OPEC+ had tentatively agreed to cut production by about 10 million barrels a day in May and June, delegates said, effectively ending a one-month oil price war. Saudi Arabia and Russia, the biggest producers in the group, would each take output down to about 8.5 million a day, with all members agreeing to cut supply by 23%, one delegate said.

Attention should have turned on Friday to the Group of 20 energy ministers meeting. A contribution from major producers including the U.S. and Canada -- possibly as much as 5 million barrels a day of further supply reductions -- could boost efforts to revive prices after the initial OPEC+ agreement failed to push crude higher on Thursday.

【中午12時】
石油輸出國組織（OPEC）及其盟國同意減產計劃，將在5月及6月每日減產1,000萬桶，並在7月至年底將每日減產700萬桶。雖然油組達成歷史性減產計劃，但卻未能刺激油價上升，其中紐約期油下跌9.29%，報22.76美元一桶；布籣特期油則下跌4.14%，報31.48美元一桶。

市場焦點將轉向將於今日召開的20國集團（G20）能源部長會議，若美國及加拿大等主要產油國亦加入減產行列，料將可帶動油價止跌回升。

美俄沙特領袖就石油協議通電話　特朗普：今明或有公布

美國總統特朗普與俄羅斯總統普京，以及沙特國王薩勒曼進行電話會議，就石油協議相關問題進行磋商。特朗普表示，三方對話非常好，油組成員國舉行會議，目前非常接近達成協議，預計在今日或明日會有公布。根據石油輸出國組織與俄羅斯為首的盟友達成減產協議，同意在5至6月每日原油產量減少1000萬桶，相當於全球總供應10%，所有成員國減產23%，應對數十年來最嚴重的油市危機，據報沙特及俄羅斯希望美國減產，但美國至今未有承諾減產，反而警告如果未能減少供應支持美國石油業，油組將面對經濟制裁。早前有報道指出，如果所有與會產油國都同意新減產協議的條件，期限將延長至2022年4月。

The 9th (Extraordinary) OPEC and non-OPEC Ministerial Meeting concludes

The 9th (Extraordinary) OPEC and non-OPEC Ministerial Meeting was held via webinar, on Thursday, 09 April 2020, under the Chairmanship of HRH Prince Abdul Aziz Bin Salman, Saudi Arabia’s Minister of Energy, and co-Chair HE Alexander Novak, Minister of Energy of the Russian Federation.

The Meeting welcomed Argentina, Colombia, Ecuador, Egypt, Indonesia, Norway, Trinidad and Tobago and the International Energy Forum (IEF) as observers.

In the meeting, the OPEC and non-OPEC oil producing countries participating in the Declaration of Cooperation, reaffirmed their continued commitment in the Declaration of Cooperation to achieve and sustain a stable oil market, the mutual interest of producing nations, the efficient, economic, and secure supply to consumers, and a fair return on invested capital.

In view of the current fundamentals and the consensus market perspectives, the Participating Countries agreed to:

1. Reaffirm the Framework of the Declaration of Cooperation, signed on 10 December 2016 and further endorsed in subsequent meetings; as well as the Charter of Cooperation, signed on 2 July 2019.

2. Adjust downwards their overall crude oil production by 10.0 mb/d, starting on 1 May 2020, for an initial period of two months that concludes on 30 June 2020. For the subsequent period of 6 months, from 1 July 2020 to 31 December 2020, the total adjustment agreed will be 8.0 mb/d. It will be followed by a 6.0 mb/d adjustment for a period of 16 months, from 1 January 2021 to 30 April 2022. The baseline for the calculation of the adjustments is the oil production of October 2018, except for the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia and The Russian Federation, both with the same baseline level of 11.0 mb/d. The agreement will be valid until 30 April 2022, however, the extension of this agreement will be reviewed during December 2021.

3. Call upon all major producers to contribute to the efforts aimed at stabilizing market.

4. Reaffirm and extend the mandate of the Joint Ministerial Monitoring Committee (JMMC) and its membership, to closely review general market conditions, oil production levels and the level of conformity with the Declaration of Cooperation and this Statement, assisted by the Joint Technical Committee (JTC) and the OPEC Secretariat.
 
5. Reaffirm that the Declaration of Cooperation conformity is to be monitored considering crude oil production, based on the information from secondary sources, according to the methodology applied for OPEC Member Countries.
 
6. Meet on 10 June 2020 via webinar, to determine further actions, as needed to balance the market.

The above was agreed by all the OPEC and non-OPEC oil producing countries participating in the Declaration of Cooperation, with the exception of Mexico, and as a result, the agreement is conditional on the consent of Mexico.

Source : https://www.opec.org/opec_web/en/press_room/5882.htm

1.基金轉倉唔會另價格下跌

2.轉倉後與下次轉倉前期間基金錶現貼現月期油表現

3.如持有基金橫越轉倉期 視乎你揸幾耐及期間contango有幾大 長遠有機會另基金錶現deviated from油價走勢 (如果難理解 你可以當成基金會每月重新調整 (相對如7500每日調整)

4.轉倉對短炒影響唔太大 (day trade, 幾日, 幾星期, 個幾月問題都不算太大, 但長揸你就要考慮埋contango呢個因素)

入去慢慢理解篇文

到呢度你可能會問明明轉倉係高水 但基金轉倉後價格無跌 咁高水轉倉在那反映出來？

我地睇多一個假設

你在R-T (轉倉前) 5蚊買左基金, 當時5月期油係USD 25

現在R+T (轉倉後) 6月期油係USD36.3, 隻基金而家係$6.05

基金其間升幅: 21%(6.05/5)

而你望到期油既升幅: 45.2% (36.3 / 25)

(換言之間 你係用緊6月既期油與當時5月既期油比較)

相比之下你會覺得基金升唔足原因就在這裡 高水的20%你只係睇到但賺唔到 呢個現象, 市場叫做implied storage cost 或者contango

總結

1.基金轉倉唔會另價格下跌

2.轉倉後與下次轉倉前期間基金錶現貼現月期油表現

3.如持有基金橫越轉倉期 視乎你揸幾耐及期間contango有幾大 長遠有機會另基金錶現deviated from油價走勢 (如果難理解 你可以當成基金會每月重新調整 (相對如7500每日調整)

4.轉倉對短炒影響唔太大 (day trade, 幾日, 幾星期, 個幾月問題都不算太大, 但長揸你就要考慮埋contango呢個因素)

現在R+T (轉倉後) 6月期油係USD36.3, 隻基金而家係$6.05

而你望到期油既升幅: 45.2% (36.3 / 25)

(換言之間 你係用緊6月既期油與當時5月既期油比較)

相比之下你會覺得基金升唔足原因就在這裡 高水的20%你只係睇到但賺唔到 呢個現象, 市場叫做implied storage cost 或者contango

總結

1.基金轉倉唔會另價格下跌

2.轉倉後與下次轉倉前期間基金錶現貼現月期油表現

3.如持有基金橫越轉倉期 視乎你揸幾耐及期間contango有幾大 長遠有機會另基金錶現deviated from油價走勢 (如果難理解 你可以當成基金會每月重新調整 (相對如7500每日調整)

4.轉倉對短炒影響唔太大 (day trade, 幾日, 幾星期, 個幾月問題都不算太大, 但長揸你就要考慮埋contango呢個因素)

到呢度你可能會問明明轉倉係高水 但基金轉倉後價格無跌 咁高水轉倉在那反映出來？

我地睇多一個假設

你在R-T (轉倉前) 5蚊買左基金, 當時5月期油係USD 25

現在R+T (轉倉後) 6月期油係USD36.3, 隻基金而家係$6.05

基金其間升幅: 21%(6.05/5)

而你望到期油既升幅: 45.2% (36.3 / 25)

(換言之間 你係用緊6月既期油與當時5月既期油比較)

相比之下你會覺得基金升唔足原因就在這裡 高水的20%你只係睇到但賺唔到 呢個現象, 市場叫做implied storage cost 或者contango

到呢度你可能會問明明轉倉係高水 但基金轉倉後價格無跌 咁高水轉倉在那反映出來？

我地睇多一個假設

你在R-T (轉倉前) 5蚊買左基金, 當時5月期油係USD 25

現在R+T (轉倉後) 6月期油係USD36.3, 隻基金而家係$6.05

基金其間升幅: 21%(6.05/5)

而你望到期油既升幅: 45.2% (36.3 / 25)

(換言之間 你係用緊6月既期油與當時5月既期油比較)

相比之下你會覺得基金升唔足原因就在這裡 高水的20%你只係睇到但賺唔到 呢個現象, 市場叫做implied storage cost 或者contango

基金價格: $4.95 (495,000 / 100,000)

基金其間跌幅: -1%(4.95/5)

而你望到期油既升幅: 18.8% (29.7 / 25)

咁講其實 contango 都有著數？
升時升不足，但跌都唔係跌足？

唔係24號

期貨轉倉
指數包含有關以第二最接近合約替換即將到期的最接近合約（亦稱為「轉倉」）的條文。最
接近合約轉倉每月為期 5 天進行，從當月第五個標普高盛營業日開始，至當月第九個標普高
盛營業日結束。舉例來說，在 2019 年 4 月轉倉期間，指數內 2019 年 5 月的 WTI 期貨合約
須由 2019 年 6 月的 WTI 期貨合約替換。

入去慢慢理解篇文

到呢度你可能會問明明轉倉係高水 但基金轉倉後價格無跌 咁高水轉倉在那反映出來？

我地睇多一個假設

你在R-T (轉倉前) 5蚊買左基金, 當時5月期油係USD 25

現在R+T (轉倉後) 6月期油係USD36.3, 隻基金而家係$6.05

基金其間升幅: 21%(6.05/5)

而你望到期油既升幅: 45.2% (36.3 / 25)

(換言之間 你係用緊6月既期油與當時5月既期油比較)

相比之下你會覺得基金升唔足原因就在這裡 高水的20%你只係睇到但賺唔到 呢個現象, 市場叫做implied storage cost 或者contango
姐係大約幾%

照篇文理解 基本上冇變 唔會點蝕 contango 睇到賺唔到
即係而家23.19 去5月既29.13 中間既變化唔關你事
但唔知點解就俾人講到當左中間既變化就你蝕既錢

好似係咁

所以即係佢一野由23.19 跳到上29.13 你係冇蝕 但係你都賺唔到 然後又因為佢上左29.13 算係好高既位 佢又唔再升上去 你咪繼續套住 回唔到本

要回本就要由29.13 上更多

簡單咁講
你而家轉倉前走同轉倉後走都係一樣

Saudis Say Mexico Must Be Part of Opec-Plus Deal
Opec's de facto leader Saudi Arabia is adamant that all members of the Opec-plus alliance must make proportionate contributions to a proposed deal to cut production by a combined 10 million barrels per day. Riyadh has indicated that the deal won't be implemented unless Mexico falls into line with the other members of the alliance.

An agreement was held up late Thursday, when Mexico rejected the proposed deal that seeks to bring global oil supplies into line with sharply reduced demand and boost crude prices that have fallen by more than half since the start of the year.

A Saudi source familiar with the matter said the kingdom stood by its position that Mexico must drop its objections, which are focused on the baseline for the production cuts it would make under the deal (IOD Apr.10'20).

During Thursday's 10-hour video conference meeting, Mexico's Energy Minister Rocio Nahle held up discussions for several hours with objections to a proposed cut of 400,000 b/d in Mexico's production from a baseline of 1.75 million b/d. Instead, Mexico offered a cut of 100,000 b/d, capping its output at 1.68 million b/d.

Saudi Arabia opposed that offer on the basis that all other Opec-plus members have agreed to cut output by 23% for a two-month period in May and June, after which production cuts would be gradually reduced but would extend through April 2022.

Sources familiar with the matter said Saudi Energy Minister Prince Abdulaziz bin Salman stood firm and insisted that Mexico must play its part.

Other ministers attending the meeting had suggested that Mexico should leave the Opec-plus alliance, so that the remaining members could agree on joint cuts of 9.6 million b/d, but Prince Abdulaziz rejected this.

The meeting ended with the Opec secretariat issuing a statement saying that an agreement had been reached but that it was "conditional on the consent of Mexico."

Meanwhile, the kingdom is willing to accept market-driven reductions in US oil output as a valid contribution to the international effort in lieu of government-mandated cuts (OD Apr.10'20). "Saudi Arabia will accept the US cutting in its own way,” another Saudi source close to the situation said.

Saudi Arabia was chairing a video conference meeting of G20 energy ministers on Friday and was hoping to secure commitments from oil-producing countries outside the Opec-plus alliance to cut their production by an additional 5 million b/d. Riyadh currently holds the rotating presidency of the G20.

Sources told Energy Intelligence that both Canada and the US were ready to cooperate with the Opec-plus initiative, although the details remained unclear.

Amena Bakr, Dubai
